column5: Not long back from my second ever Algonquin adventure We spent 3 days and 2 nights in the park - putting in at Rock Lake and making our way to Clydegale lake It was an awesome time although the fishing was a bit of a bust - not the parks fault, blame lays squarely on the anglers lol As a GTAer I am always amazed at the beauty and remoteness of Algonquin - it was around 3.5 hours from Mississauga to Rock Lake but once we crossed into Pen Lake its like being in a different world https://www.northernjacks.com/post/3-days-in-algonquin  Cheers Andrew
Lovely report. Yeah, those portages can kill you, but they are so worth it.
Thanks! Â And for sure. Â I think I forgot to include my age and weight of the gear into my equation lol. Â But was worth it Andrew

Good report. But you are still YOUNG, for God's sake!!!!!!! Algonquin is awesome, and there are better lakes that will cough up trout, even for newbies - or, I guess I have to admit, there USED TO BE such lakes.Â  I have not dipped a paddle in Algonquin for a couple decades.............ğŸ™„Â  Shoot me a note for a couple ideas, mind you the one had a portage that was a hair over a kilometre.Â  But once you are past such a portage, all the wannabes are eating your dust, it separates the men from the boys so to speak. Doug

Thanks - and for sure - I think we can definitely cut down on some gear if we decide to tackle a longer portage Lol - for sure - I only meant old in the sense that the last time I was there I was younger and in better shapeÂ  - will definitely hit you up Doug - I think we are going to return next year for sure Cheers Andrew
Better lakes for sure but tough to get too. Most will think its not worth the effort . Couple of very nice lakes closer to access pts but i'm not telling where . Check the pic
